text: Job’s Eighth Speech, Continued
“Why are not times kept by Shaddai,
and \add why\add* do not \add those who\add* know him see his days?
They\f + \fr 24:2 \ft Or “Some” (NASU, ESV) or “Men” (NIV, NET) \f* remove border \add stones\add*;
they seize flocks, and they pasture \add them\add*.
They drive away \add the\add* donkey of orphans;
they take \add the\add* widow’s ox as a pledge.
They thrust \add the\add* poor off the road;
\add the\add* needy of \add the\add* earth hide themselves together.\f + \fr 24:4 \ft Or “altogether” \f*
“Look, \add like\add* wild donkeys in the desert
they\f + \fr 24:5 \ft That is, the poor \f* go out to their labor \add as\add* searchers for the prey;
\add the\add* wilderness \add is\add*\f + \fr 24:5 \ft Or “provides” \f* ⸤their⸥\f + \fr 24:5 \ft Hebrew “for their” \f* food for the young.
They reap their\f + \fr 24:6 \ft Hebrew “his” \f* fodder in the field,
and they glean \add in the\add* vineyard of \add the\add* wicked.
They spend the night naked, ⸤without⸥\f + \fr 24:7 \ft Literally “from not” \f* clothing,
and \add they\add* have no garment in the cold.
They are wet from the rainstorm of the mountains,\f + \fr 24:8 \ft Or “from the mountain rainstorm” \f*
and they cling to the rock ⸤without⸥\f + \fr 24:8 \ft Literally “from not” \f* refuge.
“They\f + \fr 24:9 \ft That is, those who oppress the poor \f* snatch \add the\add* orphan from \add the\add* breast,
and they take a pledge against \add the\add* needy.\f + \fr 24:9 \ft Or “And they take \fq the \ft child of \fq the \ft needy as a pledge” \f*
They\f + \fr 24:10 \ft That is, the poor \f* go about naked, without clothing,
and hungry, they carry \add the\add* sheaves.\f + \fr 24:10 \ft Or “and they carry \fq the \ft sheaves \fq though \ft hungry” \f*
Between their terraces they press out oil;
they tread \add the\add* presses, but\f + \fr 24:11 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* they are thirsty.
From \add the\add* city people groan,
and \add the\add* throat\f + \fr 24:12 \ft Or “soul,” or “inner self” \f* of \add the\add* wounded cries for help;
yet\f + \fr 24:12 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* God does not ⸤regard it as unseemly⸥.\f + \fr 24:12 \ft Literally “he puts offensiveness” \f*
“Those are among \add the ones\add* rebelling \add against the\add* light;
they do not recognize his ways,
and they do not stay in his paths.
⸤At dusk⸥\f + \fr 24:14 \ft Literally “At the light” \f* the murderer rises;
he kills \add the\add* needy and \add the\add* poor,
and in the night he is like a\f + \fr 24:14 \ft Or “the” \f* thief.
And \add the\add* eye of \add the\add* adulterer waits for dusk,
saying, ⸤‘No eye will see me,’⸥\f + \fr 24:15 \ft Literally “ ‘An eye will not see me’ ” \f*
and he places a covering \add on his\add* face.
He digs through houses in the darkness;
by day they shut themselves in—
they do not know \add the\add* light
because morning likewise is to them deep darkness;
indeed, they know about \add the\add* terrors of deep darkness.
“He himself\f + \fr 24:18 \ft Emphatic personal pronoun \f* \add is\add* swift on \add the\add* water’s surface;
their portion is cursed in the land.
⸤No one turns toward the path of their vineyards⸥.\f + \fr 24:18 \ft Literally “He does not turn toward \fq the \ft path of \fq the \ft vineyard” \f*
Drought and heat snatch away \add the\add* snow waters,
\add like\add* Sheol \add snatches away\add* those\f + \fr 24:19 \ft Or “they/them” \f* \add who have\add* sinned.
\add The\add* womb forgets him.
\add The\add* maggot feasts on him \add until\add* he is no longer remembered,
and wickedness is broken like a\f + \fr 24:20 \ft Or “the” \f* tree.
\add He\add* feeds on \add the\add* barren, \add who\add* does not have a child,
and does no good to \add the\add* widow.
Yet\f + \fr 24:22 \ft Hebrew “And” \f* he\f + \fr 24:22 \ft The probable antecedent is God \f* carries off \add the\add* tyrants by his strength;

\add if\add* he rises up, then\f + \fr 24:22 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* he\f + \fr 24:22 \ft The antecedent of the singular here probably changes to the wicked person \f* cannot be certain of life.\f + \fr 24:22 \ft Hebrew “the life” \f*
He\f + \fr 24:23 \ft The probable antecedent is God \f* gives security to him, and he is\f + \fr 24:23 \ft Or “they are” \f* supported,
but\f + \fr 24:23 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* his eyes \add are\add* upon their ways.
They are exalted a little while, then\f + \fr 24:24 \ft Literally “and” \f* ⸤they are gone⸥.\f + \fr 24:24 \ft Literally “he is not” \f*
And they are brought low; they are cut off like all \add others\add*,
and like \add the\add* heads of grain they wither away.
“And if \add it is\add* not \add so\add*, then who can prove me a liar
and reduce my word to nothing?”
